titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Norman Lessing Papers PASC.0145
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by UCLA Library Performing Arts Special Collections staff, pre-1999; machine-readable finding aid created by Julie L. Graham and Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-08-18 15:43:04 -0700.

did.abstract: Norman Lessing's television career started in 1948. The collection primarily documents Lessing's television writing and includes television scripts, outlines, pilots, and story ideas. Additionally, there are motiom picture screenplays, radio scripts, and stage plays.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Norman Lessing Papers (Collection PASC 145). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by UCLA Library Performing Arts Special Collections staff, pre-1999.

Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Norman Lessing started his career writing for radio. Eventually he became a writer for television and motion pictures, worked a story editor and producer, and was also a playwright. He began his prolific television writing career in New York City and went on to work on popular programs such as Bonanza , Hawaii Five-0 , The Shirley Temple Storybook , Streets of San Francisco, and Your Show of Shows , among many others. His play 36 , was performed Off Broadway and in regional theaters in the United States. In addition to his work as a writer, Lessing was also a lifelong chess master. He died in Santa Monica, CA on October 22, 2001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of materials related to television writer Norman Lessing. Included are scripts, outlines, and story ideas. Also includes motion picture screenplays, radio scripts, and stage plays.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files are arranged alphabetically by project title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Motion Picture projects include scripts for Joy in the Morning and The Perils of Paul as well as treatments for Chez Paree and Dance Me a Long Song . The files are arranged by script title.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Produced, MGM. Script in FILM SCRIPT COLL. 073.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The series consists of script material for radio programs such as Under Arrest , House of Mystery , Hop Harrigan , and The Marriage . Additionally there are a small number of radio sketches. The series is arranged alpabetically by program title.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Stage Projects consists of play scripts, including the play 36 . The series is arranged alphabetically by title.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Prod. by the Jewish Repertory Theatre, NYC.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: A play in one act. (part of Beach House trilogy).

odd.head: General note
odd.p: A drama in three acts. Copyright 1933.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Television Projects represent Lessing's prolific career as a television writer and include scripts from programs such as The Big Story , The Betty Crocker Show , Shirley Temple's Storybook and Hawaii Five-0, among others. The files are arranged by program title.
